html:
7.11.19  2:46 pm   is the paperwork fairy real?

      no, but i'll tell you what is real and that's fairy paperwork

7.11.19  1:50 pm   People have questioned you not using capital letters all the time, but I noticed the other night typing a thought I had that using lowercase seemed to make it more interesting/distinct and evened out the sentence to have more equal meaning for each word. Is that sorta the approach you have to using them or more just for a personal flair/style?

      it's normal. i do it to help me achieve a sense of normalcy

7.11.19  1:30 pm   what is your opinion on the band radiohead

      they can be very melty

7.11.19  1:29 pm   Do you enjoy any specific sounds from nature?

      sure

7.11.19  12:37 pm   What are your thoughts on time travel? 

      as far as i can tell, time is the only way to travel

7.11.19  10:36 am   are you a time travler?

      everyone is

7.11.19  5:35 am   7.9.19  1:18 am my girlfriend says i gotta stop overthinking it and just start small (not exactly what she said but that's kinda how i understood it. sorry if that's wrong @gf) but i'm so fixated on doing the big stuff that i don't want to start small. how do i convince myself to actually sit down and learn what is necessary before getting on to the ambitious stuff? i swear this is like freaking ground hog day for me because i'm in a loop of really wanting to do music and then being scared away because everything is so overwhelming and for some reason i just can't focus on what i need to focus on to actually Start! hhhgh. i apologize.

     i strongly recommend starting with very small projects, but since you have clearly proclaimed that you do not want to do that, it seems you must complete the 12 levels of suffering, then the 13th which is the unlucky last and final level; the reason it is unlucky is because after you finish it you will be informed that there is another level after that

7.11.19  5:06 am   i just got an ad for like "write correctly and grammaticaly"

     that's the only ad i ever get

      and realized in some way some companies might try to push a viewpoint in a specific way to shift their market by painting social expectations for "writing good" or "being professional" and i think they shape the subconscious of society in a way, perhaps quite small, but surely we're not critical enough

     i am

      to be dissecting every smart technique used against us or well, to used to bias us towards a more beneficial viewpoint for their product . How far do you think fallacy regulation would take us and towards good or bad?

     true and false are very flexible

      I've gotten targeted  "coding your games is easier than you think" i'm like the fuck you know what i think, you don't know me.

     that's very common. that's what's known as an adfail. treat like any other fail. just laugh it off and be glad that it wasn't you who did the fail

      targeted ads after certain ads are shown would be a fun/perhaps informative campaign and critical thinking /fallacy informing. "Hi, if you're seeing this you just got x ad before this one, so be aware that that checkbox they're making you want to tick, by getting their product might not be a checkbox worth ticking, or not even a checkbox. theres not even paper or a document open".  Hope everythings going and doing great. Does inconsistent writing style irk you?

     no. wait what is irk

      you seem so consistent that  it seems you wouldn't not be by accident.

7.11.19  5:04 am   How "complex" do you believe our human emotional responses to music are able to get?

     i would hypothesize that it can go up to at least a 7.7

     
It seems like simple chord progressions are often enough to get people wholly excited…
Could this mean that we are often "lying" to ourselves about how "deep" and "special" our emotions can become in general?

     no

      Are they hardly more complex than those of animals, possibly an ancient evolutionary feature?

     humans are mostly world leaders in complexity, and the emotional capacity will reflect that

     
With this in mind - do you believe there are limits to musical originality/creativity and meticulous crafting in what appears to still have merit in a human audience?

     i don't think so. wait, what is merit

     
I personally still like to believe that we will always get bored and want something new - but could this "new thing" maybe just not be more than the "old thing" in disguise?

     everything is everything in disguise

7.11.19  5:01 am   would you rather live in canada or in mars? x

      i am holding out for both

7.11.19  4:30 am   What's your favorite type of pasta?

     frozen

      Got a recipe?

      you're gonna wanna take the pasta and lower it to a very cold temperature

7.11.19  12:35 am   Are you ever planning on doing more improvs?

      yes

7.10.19  11:47 pm   im bored help

      you could invent the wheel. not sure if anyone has invented it yet

7.10.19  10:30 pm   What are some good song lyrics to live by?

      we learn to live as we learn to give each other what we need to survive together alive

7.10.19  9:46 pm   Hard one for you, what are the chords here in the first 6 seconds before he starts singing? https://youtu.be/VNzK8g0oNEA

      F#, C#7, then Aaug triad with right hand, then it seems to be Aaug triad in the right hand with F# maj triad in the left hand (oops). and not lifing the pedal through there to make it extra sloppy. then another F# maj in the right hand, then another Aaug and another left handed F# chord. feel like i need a napkin

7.10.19  8:20 pm   who tf are you

      tom jones

7.10.19  8:08 pm   How do I make a good taco?

      take a medium/average taco, and put it into a paper shredder

7.10.19  7:55 pm   I found 3 more wasps in my room. How am I alive 

      perhaps you are the chosen one

7.10.19  7:36 pm   maybe one day you could get a machine with linux based os. all that open-source software would be yours to tamper with. then you'd have true power over your computer and could get the professional, mouse-free experience you crave

      i love the mouse. i just don't want the mouse to always have to do keyboard things. i want 5 mouses. doing mouse things

7.10.19  7:36 pm   Someone once told me "you don't really know something until you know how to explain it to someone else". Do you think that's true?

      please explain

7.10.19  7:05 pm   Did you know that the melody during "I don't think that anything" in And the Day Goes On is t h r i l l i n g

      would you believe me if i told you it's actually the chords that make it seem like the melody is thrilling

7.10.19  7:05 pm   Are you dead inside?

      let me run some tests

7.10.19  6:42 pm   https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=utL9IDe-2Q0

Is this purdie shuffle or something else? I really want to learn to play this but I dont think i can dive in without some sort of tips of how to get the whole thing together, i lack the rhythmic perspective atm. Would appreciate any tips. 

      i think you would need these extra hi hat notes: purdie.png (circled them)

      it keeps me educated

      that's just simple mummification, i assume

      sure

      india

      i was going to say no, but now that i think about it yes

      perhaps they are made of polyester

      yes

      i can't tell you

      sure

7.10.19  7:22 am   Ey Bill, what's your favorite animal? Wild or Pet wise, it doesn't really matter.

      person

7.10.19  4:52 am   What to do about writers block?

     you must think outside the block

      I'll get going on a song or arrangement then get stuck because I can't figure out what's supposed to happen next according to my brain and ears

     i always finish the writing before starting the arrangement. because the whole world is so much more maluable, flexible, .... editable, in this way

7.10.19  4:35 am   Do you prefer oceans or mountains

     i'm willing to wait until there is a way to combine the 2

7.10.19  3:29 am   do you use a click track when recording? Just realizing perhaps producing to a click track is dehumanizing in a way

     it is, but, doing a full band's worth of instruments by yourself is not exactly human either. will turn into mush if you don't have something holding it together

     that sounds boring

     yes

7.9.19  7:28 pm   2 questions, HINT FOR NEXT VID?

     i just have 1 question, and i'm tired of asking it in my head, and in my subconscious, for so many years, .... it's time to get it out in the open. the question is this: why, on god's gracious green benevolent moist earth, would anyone EVER , under any circumstances, make a piece of software that is ANY LESS than 100% controllable by keyboard commands??????????????????????????????? why do people do that???? why would anyone EVER do that, and yet that's the only thing anyone seems to have ever done ??????? What world am i in????????????????????????????????????????????????????????????????????????????????

      Also, what do you edit your videos with?

      keyboard maestro
